raw_response: Naja, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish, appears as a firm, herb-speckled frittata-like dish with a rich greenish hue from abundant herbs. When served, it has a solid, dense texture rather than soupy or stew-like, owing to its beaten eggs or chickpea flour base in vegan versions. It is typically presented sliced or cut into large, flat, wedge-like pieces, much like a thick pancake or omelette, and served on a plate rather than in a bowl.
